data.price: Sọ pé: “Mo sá di Olúwa òwúrọ̀ kùtùkùtù
níbi aburú ohun tí Ó dá,¹
data.footnotes: 1. Allāhu ni Ẹlẹ́dàá gbogbo n̄ǹkan, ohun rere àti ohun burúkú. Ọ̀kan pàtàkì nínú ohun burúkú nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá tí Allāhu dá ni aṣ-Ṣaetọ̄n àti àwọn ọmọ ogun rẹ̀ bí àjẹ́, oṣó, emèrè, àwọn n̄ǹkan olóró àti àwọn iwọ. Nítorí náà, Èṣù kọ́ ló dá owó àti dúkìá. Ẹni tí ó bá wá tọrọ owó ní ọ̀dọ̀ Èṣù, ó ti di ẹlẹ́bọ, ẹni Èṣù.

data.price: àti níbi aburú òru nígbà tí ó bá ṣóòkùn,
àti níbi aburú àwọn (òpìdán) tó ń fẹnu fátẹ́gùn túẹ́túẹ́ sínú àwọn ońdè,
àti níbi aburú onílara nígbà tí ó bá ṣe ìlara.”
Sọ pé: “Mo sá di Olúwa àwọn ènìyàn,

data.footnotes: 1. Ìtúmọ̀ “Ọlọ́hun àwọn ènìyàn” ni pé, Ẹni tí àwọn ènìyàn gbọ́dọ̀ máa jọ́sìn fún ní ọ̀nà òdodo, tí wọn kò sì gbọ́dọ̀ jọ́sìn fún ẹlòmíìràn lẹ́yìn Rẹ̀.

data.price: níbi aburú (Èṣù) oníròyíròyí, olùsásẹ́yìn (fún ẹni tó bá ń dárúkọ Allāhu¹).
data.footnotes:
1. Ọ̀kan pàtàkì nínú àǹfààní àti oore tí ó wà nínú ath-thikār ṣíṣe ni pé, Èṣù àti àwọn ọmọ ogun rẹ̀ yóò máa sá sẹ́yìn fún ẹni tí ó bá ń ṣe ath-thikār ní gbogbo ìgbà. Kí á sì rántí wí pé, ọ̀kan pàtàkì jùlọ nínú ohun tí mùsùlùmí yóò máa fi ṣe ath-thikār ni kíké al-Ƙur’ān alápọ̀n-ọ́nlé ní ojoojúmọ́ ní díẹ̀ díẹ̀. Lẹ́yìn náà ni àwọn gbólóhùn ath-thikār èyí tí ó wà nínú ẹ̀gbàwá hadīth Ànábì - kí ìkẹ́ àti ọlà Allāhu máa bá a -. 
 Kí á sì jìnnà tefétefé sí àwọn ìkàkúkà tí wọ́n ń pè ní “wiridi àti waṭḥīfah” èyí tí àwọn ààfáà ẹlẹ́bọ, àwọn ààfáà onibidiah àti àwọn ààfáà onisūfī dáálẹ̀. Bí mùsùlùmí kò bá jìnnà tefétefé sí àwọn irúfẹ́ “wiridi àti waṭḥīfah” bẹ́ẹ̀, yàtọ̀ sí pé, ó máa di kèfèrí lórí rẹ̀, àwọn èṣù yóò máa bá onítọ̀ún fínra.

data.price: (Èṣù ni) ẹni tí ó ń kó ròyíròyí sínú àwọn ọkàn ènìyàn.
(Èṣù náà) wà nínú àwọn àlùjànnú àti àwọn ènìyàn.”

dua.name: Dua for Protection
dua.significanceReason: Powerful duas seeking protection from negative energies, evil intentions, and spiritual harm. Considered a shield against potential dangers.

version.title: Yoruba translation
version.description: Translation of the Quran meanings into Yoruba by Abu Rahima Mikhail Aikweiny, printed in 1432 H.
